page.title: 06Sheep Farming
page.content: Sheep are the main form of livestock bred and reared in this hill farming area. Although there are a mixture of certain breeds such as Suffolk, Leicester or Suffolk and Leicester crosses, Teeswater etc., one of the most popular breeds is the local Swaledale because it is hardy as well as productive. Present prices for 'run of the mill' sheep can vary from about Â£30 to Â£100 but a good individual breeding stock animal, particularly a ram can fetch Â£8,000 or more. Breeders in the area usually enter their best animals at the local shows and it is these show champions which bring these premium price. By law, sheep have to be dipped twice per year, in Autumn, in order to prevent 'sheep scab'. They are also 'drenched' or 'wormed' and their hooves sprayed to avoid 'foot rot'.
